children.value: objects holds state needed to perform transform feedback operations. They store the buffer bindings that are being recorded to. This makes it easy to switch between different sets of feedback buffer bindings (somewhat similar to how
objects includes the buffers the GPU will use to record the requested varyings.

Finally, note that when using transform feedback it is frequently desirable to turn off rasterization:
to prevent the fragment shader from running.

= (Object) - Gets a mapping of varying name to buffer indices from a linked program if supplied.
=(Object) - Map of location index or name to Buffer object or buffer parameters object. If buffer parameters object is supplied, it contains following fields.
=(Number, default: 0) - Byte offset that is used to start recording the data in the buffer.
=(Number, default: remaining buffer size) - Size in bytes that is used for recording the data.
